definition: to look at/to watch/to observe/to behold/to advise/concept/point of view/outlook
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
to watch the fires burning across the river/to delay entering the fray until all others have been exhausted by fighting amongst themselves (idiom)
clear as a flame (idiom); to see things absolutely clearly

sentences.english: I know their tricks and stratagems.
sentences.chinese: 我對他們的花招和戰略洞若觀火。

sentences.english: I would not mind any of this if the French did not keep harping on with malicious glee about how tough things are across the Atlantic.
sentences.chinese: 法國人對大西洋彼岸的窘境隔岸觀火我並不介意。
